newsitem.title: USA: Quarterdeck to enter anti-virus market.
newsitem.headline: Quarterdeck to enter anti-virus market.

text.p: Utility software maker Quarterdeck Corp on Monday said it has acquired global licensing rights to anti-virus software technology and is set to enter the growing computer anti-virus market.
Quarterdeck's anti-virus product, named ViruSweep, is built on technology licensed from privately-held EliaShim Ltd, ViruSweep will be integrated into its portfolio of system protection products.

A computer virus, once activated inside a PC, automatically copies itself, thereby "infecting" other programs or disks without the user knowing it, and then plays tricks or disrupts the operation of the computer.
Quarterdeck's anti-virus product will compete with products made by McAfee Associates Inc, Symantec Corp and Computer Associates International Inc's Cheyenne Software unit.
